intro: Senecio dalmaticus, commonly known as the Dalmatian groundsel, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and hillsides. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
